``` ::: ::: ::: ## Hooks ### Manual insertion ::: {#6b76cb39 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} class SequentialModel(nn.Module): def __init__(self, *layers): super().__init__() self.layers = nn.ModuleList(layers) self.act_means = [[] for _ in layers] self.act_stds = [[] for _ in layers] def __call__(self, x): for i,l in enumerate(self.layers): x = l(x) self.act_means[i].append(to_cpu(x).mean()) self.act_stds [i].append(to_cpu(x).std ()) return x def __iter__(self): return iter(self.layers) ``` ::: ::: {#a347b245 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(1) model = SequentialModel(*cnn_layers()) learn = fit(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {#8a6e069c .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} for l in model.act_means: plt.plot(l) plt.legend(range(5)); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](10_activations_files/figure-html/cell-13-output-1.png){width=590 height=411} ::: ::: ::: {#9f90d830 .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} for l in model.act_stds: plt.plot(l) plt.legend(range(5)); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](10_activations_files/figure-html/cell-14-output-1.png){width=590 height=411} ::: ::: ### Pytorch hooks Hooks are PyTorch object you can add to any nn.Module. A hook will be called when a layer, it is registered to, is executed during the forward pass (forward hook) or the backward pass (backward hook). Hooks don't require us to rewrite the model. ::: {#3dc7c553 .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(1) model = nn.Sequential(*cnn_layers()) ``` ::: A hook is attached to a layer, and needs to have a function that takes three arguments: module, input, output. Here we store the mean and std of the output in the correct position of our list. ::: {#39187f01 .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} act_means = [[] for _ in model] act_stds = [[] for _ in model] ``` ::: ::: {#a576dffa .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} def append_stats(i, mod, inp, outp): act_means[i].append(to_cpu(outp).mean()) act_stds [i].append(to_cpu(outp).std()) ``` ::: ::: {#e92ff003 .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} for i,m in enumerate(model): m.register_forward_hook(partial(append_stats, i)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {#da55f21b .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} for o in act_means: plt.plot(o) plt.legend(range(5)); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](10_activations_files/figure-html/cell-20-output-1.png){width=590 height=411} ::: ::: ### Hook class We can refactor this in a Hook class. It's very important to remove the hooks when they are deleted, otherwise there will be references kept and the memory won't be properly released when your model is deleted. ::: {#99c2435b .cell 0='e' 1='x' 2='p' 3='o' 4='r' 5='t' execution_count=20} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Hook(): def __init__(self, m, f): self.hook = m.register_forward_hook(partial(f, self)) def remove(self): self.hook.remove() def __del__(self): self.remove() ``` ::: ::: {#da1700e7 .cell execution_count=21} ``` {.python .cell-code} def append_stats(hook, mod, inp, outp): if not hasattr(hook,'stats'): hook.stats = ([],[]) acts = to_cpu(outp) hook.stats[0].append(acts.mean()) hook.stats[1].append(acts.std()) ``` ::: ::: {#b9cce496 .cell execution_count=22} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(1) model = nn.Sequential(*cnn_layers()) ``` ::: ::: {#4d93ac73 .cell execution_count=23} ``` {.python .cell-code} hooks = [Hook(l, append_stats) for l in model[:5].children()] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ### A Hooks class ::: {#cb5d9327 .cell execution_count=26} ``` {.python .cell-code} class DummyCtxMgr: def __enter__(self, *args): print("let's go!") return self def __exit__ (self, *args): print("all done!") def hello(self): print("hello.") ``` ::: ::: {#f87a35ae .cell execution_count=27} ``` {.python .cell-code} with DummyCtxMgr() as dcm: dcm.hello() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` let's go! hello. all done! ``` ::: ::: ::: {#254e9e02 .cell execution_count=28} ``` {.python .cell-code} class DummyList(list): def __delitem__(self, i): print(f"Say bye to item {i}") super().__delitem__(i) ``` ::: ::: {#adc37342 .cell execution_count=29} ``` {.python .cell-code} dml = DummyList([1,3,2]) dml ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=29} ``` [1, 3, 2] ``` ::: ::: ::: {#a29c9ea4 .cell execution_count=30} ``` {.python .cell-code} del(dml[2]) dml ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Say bye to item 2 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=30} ``` [1, 3] ``` ::: ::: ::: {#dc4f5c14 .cell 0='e' 1='x' 2='p' 3='o' 4='r' 5='t' execution_count=31} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Hooks(list): def __init__(self, ms, f): super().__init__([Hook(m, f) for m in ms]) def __enter__(self, *args): return self def __exit__ (self, *args): self.remove() def __del__(self): self.remove() def __delitem__(self, i): self[i].remove() super().__delitem__(i) def remove(self): for h in self: h.remove() ``` ::: ::: {#3e0d43da .cell execution_count=32} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(1) model = nn.Sequential(*cnn_layers()) ``` ::: ::: {#2c0b1d2c .cell execution_count=33} ``` {.python .cell-code} with Hooks(model, append_stats) as hooks: fit(model) fig,axs = plt.subplots(1,2, figsize=(10,4)) for h in hooks: for i in 0,1: axs[i].plot(h.stats[i]) plt.legend(range(6)); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ### HooksCallback ::: {#e8db33a1 .cell 0='e' 1='x' 2='p' 3='o' 4='r' 5='t' execution_count=34} ``` {.python .cell-code} class HooksCallback(Callback): def __init__(self, hookfunc, mod_filter=fc.noop, on_train=True, on_valid=False, mods=None): fc.store_attr() super().__init__() def before_fit(self, learn): if self.mods: mods=self.mods else: mods = fc.filter_ex(learn.model.modules(), self.mod_filter) self.hooks = Hooks(mods, partial(self._hookfunc, learn)) def _hookfunc(self, learn, *args, **kwargs): if (self.on_train and learn.training) or (self.on_valid and not learn.training): self.hookfunc(*args, **kwargs) def after_fit(self, learn): self.hooks.remove() def __iter__(self): return iter(self.hooks) def __len__(self): return len(self.hooks) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ## ActivationStats ::: {#f7998baf .cell 0='e' 1='x' 2='p' 3='o' 4='r' 5='t' execution_count=44} ``` {.python .cell-code} class ActivationStats(HooksCallback): def __init__(self, mod_filter=fc.noop): super().__init__(append_stats, mod_filter) def color_dim(self, figsize=(11,5)): fig,axes = get_grid(len(self), figsize=figsize) for ax,h in zip(axes.flat, self): show_image(get_hist(h), ax, origin='lower') def dead_chart(self, figsize=(11,5)): fig,axes = get_grid(len(self), figsize=figsize) for ax,h in zip(axes.flatten(), self): ax.plot(get_min(h)) ax.set_ylim(0,1) def plot_stats(self, figsize=(10,4)): fig,axs = plt.subplots(1,2, figsize=figsize) for h in self: for i in 0,1: axs[i].plot(h.stats[i]) axs[0].set_title('Means') axs[1].set_title('Stdevs') plt.legend(fc.L.range(self)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}
